tva:BasicDescription.tva:Title: Antonio Banderas - La Malagueña (Érase Una Vez En México)
tva:BasicDescription.tva:Synopsis:
Intro de la película "Érase Una Vez En México" por Antonio Banderas tocando "La Malagueña" en guitarra española, ¡excelente!, ¡muy buenos solos!
Intro for The film "Once Upon A Time In Mexico by Antonio Banderas playing "La Malagueña" on a spanish guitar, excellent!, very good soloing!

tva:Genre.tva:Name: Non-linear audio-video
tva:Genre.tva:Definition: Services where the interaction is based mostly around choosing alternate audio or video files - VOD and AOD, maybe combined with 2.1.1.15 (multi stream)

tva:HowRelated.tva:Name: Recommendation
tva:HowRelated.tva:Definition: The reference points to a resource recommended the provider of the current resource. The service provider considers there to be similarities between the currently described resource and the referenced resource. Example: This could provide access to previous or next episodes or to all episodes (the parent series as a whole). Suggestion to record a programme which the broadcaster recommends because of what the user is watching.It could also point to a Web site proposing related programmes ‘recommended’ by the service provider. A recommendation can be used to suggest content or services or services bundles with a similar subject.

tva:Review.tva:FreeTextReview: Fuck you stupid canadian, we are glad too of not having BORING and dull people like﻿ you here.
abuelita soy﻿ tu nieto
just so you know, Antonio isn't﻿ Mexican
MEXICO﻿
español!! como en peru, chile, colmbia, ecuador,﻿ argentina, paraguay y uruguay!!!
spanish﻿
me gusta﻿ mucho
Spanish﻿
what﻿ do you mean by SPANISH,
guadalajara guadalajara, hueles a pura tierra mojada! que bonita ciudad! desde europa pal mundo entero:VIVA﻿ MEXICO.
le dijeron toquela no llévesela wey, pero muy﻿ buena
V I V A E S P A Ñ A﻿
VIVA MEXICO HASTA y﻿ despues de LA MUERTE!
spanish greetings from﻿ EGYPT
Spanish﻿
LA MALAGUENA﻿ ES MEXICANA Y NO ESPANIOLA: PUNTO
1:57. Holy﻿ moly!!! That´s just awesome
ANTONIO﻿ ES ESPAÑOL, PERO YA TIENE ALMA MEXICANA
Se robo la﻿ guitarra!
But he is indeed playing a mexican in that movie? and in case you were wondering mariachi has very litte﻿ if any influence on spanish popular music.
Malageña hoy y﻿ siempre Mexicana....
